p: 100 g powder of dried aerial parts were added together with 1 L distilled water into a 2 L round-bottomed bottle, which was connected to a Clevenger-type apparatus with tap water for cooling. The hydrodistillation was continued for 4 h to extract the essential oils. The obtained essential oil was collected from the side arm and dried with anhydrous sodium sulphate, then sealed in a headspace bottle and stored at 4 Â°C until it was tested.
